title: Giorgio Rassaval
text:
Giorgio Rassaval (born ) is an Italian former professional <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> footballer who played in the 1950s. He played at representative level for <a href="Italy%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">Italy</a> and at club level for <a href="Torino%20XIII">Torino XIII</a>, as a , i.e. number 3 or 4.
Playing career.
International honours.
<a href="Vincenzo%20Bertolotto">Vincenzo Bertolotto</a> co-organised (with Dennis Chappell from <a href="Wakefield">Wakefield</a> and a <a href="Turin">Turin</a> resident), and <a href="Captain%20%28sports%29">captain</a>ed the <a href="Italy%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">Italy</a> rugby league tour of 1950 to France (3 matches), England (including 28-49 defeat by <a href="Wigan%20Warriors">Wigan</a> at <a href="Central%20Park%20%28Wigan%29">Central Park</a> on Saturday 26 August 1950, <a href="Huddersfield%20Giants">Huddersfield</a> at <a href="Fartown%20Ground">Fartown Ground</a> on Wednesday 6 September 1950, <a href="St%20Helens%20R.F.C.">St. Helens</a> at <a href="Knowsley%20Road">Knowsley Road</a> on Thursday 16 November 1950) and Wales (including 11-29 defeat by South Wales XIII at <a href="Brewery%20Field">Brewery Field</a>, <a href="Bridgend">Bridgend</a>, on Saturday 2 September 1950).
The Italy rugby league squad was <a href="Guido%20Aleati">Guido Aleati</a> (previously of <a href="R.S.%20Ginnastica%20Torino">R.S. Ginnastica Torino</a> (RU)), <a href="Sergio%20Aleati">Sergio Aleati</a> (previously of R.S. Ginnastica Torino (RU)), <a href="Roberto%20Antonioli">Roberto Antonioli</a> (previously of R.S. Ginnastica Torino (RU)), <a href="Angelo%20Arrigoni">Angelo Arrigoni</a> (previously of R.S. Ginnastica Torino (RU)), <a href="Vincenzo%20Bertolotto">Vincenzo Bertolotto</a> (previously of R.S. Ginnastica Torino (RU)), <a href="Michele%20Bietto">Michele Bietto</a>, <a href="Giovanni%20Bonino">Giovanni Bonino</a> (previously of R.S. Ginnastica Torino (RU)), <a href="Luigi%20Bosia">Luigi Bosia</a>, <a href="Giuseppe%20Cannone">Giuseppe Cannone</a>, <a href="Pasquale%20Cannone">Pasquale Cannone</a>, <a href="Delio%20Caron">Delio Caron</a>, <a href="Gabriele%20Casalegno">Gabriele Casalegno</a> (previously of R.S. Ginnastica Torino (RU)), <a href="Amerio%20Chiara">Amerio Chiara</a>, <a href="Giorgio%20Cornacchia">Giorgio Cornacchia</a>, <a href="Guido%20Cornarino">Guido Cornarino</a> (previously of R.S. Ginnastica Torino (RU)), <a href="Fabrizio%20Faglioli">Fabrizio Faglioli</a>, <a href="Enzo%20Francesconi">Enzo Francesconi</a>, <a href="Giuseppe%20Franco">Giuseppe Franco</a>, <a href="Aldo%20Guglielminotti">Aldo Guglielminotti</a> (previously of R.S. Ginnastica Torino (RU)), <a href="Giovanni%20Orecchia">Giovanni Orecchia</a>, <a href="Luigi%20Pignattaro">Luigi Pignattaro</a>, <a href="Franco%20Pipino">Franco Pipino</a>, Giorgio Rassaval, <a href="Giorgio%20Rubino">Giorgio Rubino</a>, <a href="Giovanni%20Tamagno">Giovanni Tamagno</a> (previously of R.S. Ginnastica Torino (RU)), <a href="Oreste%20Tescari">Oreste Tescari</a> and <a href="Giovanni%20Vigna">Giovanni Vigna</a>.
Club career.
Following the Italy rugby league tour of 1950 to France, England, and Wales, a <a href="Torino%20XIII">Torino XIII</a> featuring Giorgio Rassaval joined the French league.
